Sequence Information.Peptide Name: P5-CT1 (Lys-rich; Leu-rich; synthetic AMPs, UCLL1; XXA)

Literature.Author: Kwon JY, Kim MK, Mereuta L, Seo CH, Luchian T, Park Y. 2019
Literature.Title: Mechanism of action of antimicrobial peptide P5 truncations against Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Staphylococcus aureus.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (88.89%) toP5K: 50%; L: 38%; W: 6%.  GRAVY: -0.68; M Wt: 2005.665; Mol formula: C100H182N25O17; molar extinction coeff: 5550.Activity: active against Gram-  P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 1.56 uM), A. baumannii KCTC 2508 (MIC 3.13 uM), Gram+ S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 1.56 uM), and B. subtilis KCTC 2217 (MIC 1.56 uM).Antimicrobial robustness:  NaCl-insensitive:P. aeruginosa (150 mM); NaCl-insensitive:S. aureus; MgCl2-sensitive:P. aeruginosa (2 mM); MgCl2-insensitive:S. aureus. FeCl3-insensitive:P. aeruginosa (8 uM); FeCl3-insensitive:S. aureus (8 uM).Structure: helical in 50% TFE. Provided by Arjun Nair.
